issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I had a scaling group with capacity of 2.  I set the desired capacity to Zero and the instances started to shutdown. Then I noticed that 1 more was spawned. I took a look at scaling activities and noticed this:

{code}
[root@b-27 ~]# euscale-describe-scaling-activities
ACTIVITY	be6c33a7-e7be-462d-af75-a93def123341	2014-03-26T17:34:23.250Z	Test-ASG-1395854587.42	Failed	com.eucalyptus.ws.EucalyptusRemoteFault: Action:ProblemAction Code:soapenv:Client Id:RelatesTo Error:
ACTIVITY	2b64bf69-c2df-4b12-a458-20b917906581	2014-03-26T17:34:23.069Z	Test-ASG-1395854587.42	Successful
ACTIVITY	b245440d-cb0e-4f24-8322-9a18b4fd4d59	2014-03-26T17:34:13.558Z	Test-ASG-1395854587.42	Failed	com.eucalyptus.ws.EucalyptusRemoteFault: Action:ProblemAction Code:soapenv:Client Id:RelatesTo Error:
ACTIVITY	b0bc7958-ffad-431c-a3f1-045def670660	2014-03-26T17:34:03.612Z	Test-ASG-1395854587.42	Failed	com.eucalyptus.ws.EucalyptusRemoteFault: Action:ProblemAction Code:soapenv:Client Id:RelatesTo Error:
{code}

It indicates the error but it looks like there should have been some more information included after "RelatesTo Error:"  It seems to me that the trailing ":" indicates there could be something else that could help diagnose but it is ambiguous and maybe the problem is saying it relates to just some sort of generic error.  In the case that there should be more information included this issue would be to show that as well. If the error is just saying there was an error then we should remove the trailing ":"

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.0.0
Release     : 0.0.747.20140326git7c137674.el6

topology
\[CLC\]
\[UFS CC SC\]
\[NC\]

comments.body:
The message only appears for autoscaling groups that registered instances with a load balancer and that load balancer had been deleted before the scaling group.

To Reproduce
# create load balancer
# create launch config and scaling group. specify the LB for the auto scaling group
# after all instances are running delete the load balancer
# after loadbalancer servo has terminated set desired capacity of the scaling group to zero (probably will see the same if just changing the capacity to anything)
Please also check the output of "euscale-describe-scaling-activities --show-long"
[~tony], could you run with --show-long and --debug to see the entire message?

With show-long the error message is the same
{code}
ACTIVITY        844ecdfa-40ba-4ba3-ad70-3cef6bf8c0dc    2014-03-27T21:42:34.463Z        asg1    Failed  com.eucalyptus.ws.EucalyptusRemoteFault: Action:ProblemAction Code:soapenv:Client Id:RelatesTo Error:   At 2014-03-27T21:42:01Z a user request explicitly set group desired capacity changing the desired capa
city from 1 to 0.	100                     2014-03-27T21:42:34.222Z
{code}

With --show-long and --debug the message is the same too
{code}

{code}

Changing this to blocker as there are some general issues with error handling that need to be addressed and the behaviour of Auto Scaling when deregistration fails is bad (retries deregistration every 10 seconds indefinitely)

The specific error condition for this bug is now handled differently. If the load balancer is not found when deregistering instances all the instances are moved out of the registered state rather than retrying the activity.

Retries for registration action failures are now correctly limited to the configured value (5 by default)

Errors from the load balancing service now return the correct AWS/ELB error codes.

Handling of errors from services accessed via internal bindings is improved so the error messages for auto scaling activity failures will be better.

Fix Verified.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.0.0
Release     : 0.0.909.20140421gitb5966fda.el6

No error was reproduced using original case and messaging is better
